title: Comment on Ben Taub Hospital Active Shooter Reports: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know by Adam
text:
Share Tweet Follow 
There were reports of an active shooter at Ben Taub Hospital in Houston, Texas. 
One reporter said on Twitter that an enraged patient may have opened fire inside the hospital. You can watch a live news report from the scene above. 
News crews were headed to the scene, but the reports were not yet confirmed on the afternoon of February 21, although police said they were responding to a shooting report. One media report said there was an active shooter on the second floor of the hospital, and it was being evacuated. Ben Taub hospital evacuated, active shooter reported on second floor, several shots fired. 
— Tim Wetzel (@KHOUTim) February 21, 2017 
Here’s what you need to know: 1. Houston Police Confirmed There Were Reports of a Shooting at the Hospital 
— Jon Hagedorn, MD (@jonhagedornmd) February 21, 2017 
Houston police confirmed that they were responding to reports of shots fired, and the SWAT team was also on route. We are responding to reports of shots fired at Ben Taub Hospital; SWAT and PIO enroute #hounews 
— Houston Police (@houstonpolice) February 21, 2017 
Police have released few other details as the situation is still active. According to The Houston Chronicle , the reports began coming in around 2 p.m. on February 21. 2. There Were Social Media Reports of People Hiding in Closets @dannyherm1 @KHOU my friend is a nurse there and he is hiding in the closet. 
— M&M Lopez (@maezlopez) February 21, 2017 
One man reported on social media that his friend was a nurse and was “hiding in a closet.” Ben Taub doctor says he's already left building; his coworkers are sheltered on the hospital's second floor. 
— Mike Hixenbaugh (@Mike_Hixenbaugh) February 21, 2017 
A doctor told the news media he had left the building but co-workers were hiding on the second floor. 3. One News Report Said a Patient Grew Angry When Asked to Remove Clothing for an X-Ray Praying for the people at #BenTaub Hospital pic.twitter.com/3ZM0o3Xaik 
— Emilio R. Hinojosa (@SpecialOps52) February 21, 2017 
An ABC 6 news anchor wrote on Twitter, “A man fired shots at a Houston hospital just now. The patient was upset when asked to remove his clothes for an x-ray at Ben Taub hospital.” 4. A News Helicopter Caught Images of Police Moving Toward the Building Police responding to reports of active shooter at Ben Taub Hospital https://t.co/5AOpOT7hsP via @ABC13Houston 
— Mario M. (@newsthrottle) February 21, 2017 
Patients and staff were evacuated as police moved cautiously toward the building. The hospital was on lockdown, according to social media reports. 5. It Was Unclear Whether Anyone Was Injured 
It appears there were shots fired in Houston, although whether anyone was injured is not yet known.
